title: Update desktop search badge logo image and badge background to theme accent

requirements.summary: Replace the desktop header search input’s decorative badge icon image with the provided Cloudinary logo URL, without affecting the mobile centered logo.
acceptanceCriteria: On desktop (md+), the icon displayed inside the search input uses the provided Cloudinary URL.
The change only affects the desktop search bar badge icon and does not change the mobile centered logo image.

file_operations.description: In the desktop search input decorative badge (the absolute-positioned, pointer-events-none icon inside the input), replace the src currently pointing to the local frog-face asset with https://res.cloudinary.com/dbnj80s9g/image/upload/v1770762364/newribbitlogo_hcnzwy.png. Keep the mobile centered logo ( image) unchanged and keep the badge image decorative (empty alt).

requirements.summary: Update the desktop search badge container background to use the app’s accent theme token/class rather than a hard-coded color, keeping the badge circular and non-interactive.
acceptanceCriteria: On desktop (md+), the circular badge behind the search bar logo uses the theme accent color (e.g., Tailwind bg-accent / CSS variable --accent), not an inline hard-coded oklch value.
The badge remains circular, positioned inside the search input, and remains non-interactive (pointer-events-none).

file_operations.description: Update the decorative badge container div inside the desktop search input to use the theme accent color via Tailwind (e.g., add bg-accent) instead of the current inline backgroundColor oklch value. Preserve existing absolute positioning, sizing (1.75rem square), rounded-full for circular shape, and pointer-events-none behavior; remove only the hard-coded background color while keeping width/height styling as-is (or replace with equivalent Tailwind sizing utilities if already used elsewhere in this file).
